author: Chloe Alexander
title: AMBER Alert update: Missing 1-year-old Noah Johnson found safe | khou.com
text: HOUSTON — A [Houston Regional AMBER Alert ](https://www.facebook.com/TXCenter/posts/pfbid037h13QxAFuet6FxkfkBcwiA3KsNDoB4T2MheW9tevJAhqxYp6wd1bzr3Wxyw7KcdXl)was canceled for 1-year-old Noah Johnson after he was found safe, according to the [Texas Center for the Missing](https://centerforthemissing.org/). Noah was found in Minneapolis, Minnesota on Thursday and was evaluated by medical personnel in that city, according to the Harris County Pct. 8 Constable's Office. It's unknown if he will be brought back to Houston. Noah's mom, Kamilah Antoinette Johnson, 38, was taken into custody by the Minneapolis Police Department on an active arrest warrant filed by Pct. 8 on a felony charge of child endangerment. She's awaiting the extradition process back to Harris County. Timeline of Noah's disappearance Tuesday, Feb. 6. -- The last time Noah was seen. Thursday, Feb. 8 -- A [statewide AMBER Alert ](/article/news/local/missing/houston-texas-amber-alert-space-center-boulevard-genoa-red-bluff/285-c8d48b9d-9340-45ad-8885-9625ac517435)was issued for Noah after concerns his mother took him from a hospital and didn't pick up his prescription, Pct. 8 deputies said. Investigators said Noah has a serious medical condition that could worsen if he doesn't get the medication. According to deputies, Kamilah had taken Noah out of the hospital, saying she was going to seek holistic healthcare for his condition. Noah's doctors asked CPS to do a welfare check after they found out his mother hadn't picked up his prescription. CPS called deputies who went to the family's apartment on [Space Center Boulevard near Genoa Red Bluff Road](https://www.google.com/maps/place/11400+Space+Center+Blvd,+Houston,+TX+77034/@29.6285731,-95.1470038,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x86409933264aab67:0x126f0fc6f1269d6e!8m2!3d29.6285685!4d-95.1444289!16s%2Fg%2F11cslp1vx4?entry=ttu), but Noah and his mother weren't there. Investigators said they received information that Kamilah was seen loading her vehicle up and leaving her apartment with her children. Friday, Feb. 16 -- The [statewide AMBER Alert for Noah Johnson was canceled](/article/news/local/missing/amber-alert-noah-johnson-houston-missing/285-c0127765-adf8-4564-91af-a47403e9e781), but officials said the Houston Regional Amber Alert remained active. Tuesday, Feb. 27 -- An [ AMBER Alert was issued out of the state of Missouri ](https://www.moalerts.mo.gov/)after officials said Kamilah was last known to be at a Walmart in Kansas City, Missouri on Feb. 26. Thursday, Feb. 29 -- The Houston Regional AMBER Alert was canceled after Noah was found safe.

author: Jessica Coates
title: Australian woman training to become country's first female astronaut | The Advocate | Burnie, TAS
text: A mum-of-two is one step closer to being Australia's first female astronaut. [Australian Space Agency](/story/8449301/) employee Katherine Bennell-Pegg announced she was halfway through her year-long training at the European Astronaut Centre in Germany. While other Australian women have trained to go to space, they've always done so under the flags of other countries. Ms Bennell-Beg and her family relocated to Europe for the intensive training process. More than 22,000 people applied to the coveted position in hopes of becoming an astronaut candidate. The job requires rigorous physical training, as well as a year of intensive study. "I have always dreamed of being an astronaut," she said. "When I was young, it was for the adventure but after more than a decade working in space it's now because I know the role it plays in tackling real-world problems." The next six months are expected to include intense exercise, sea survival, studying space station robotic arm simulations and centrifuge training. "We need to know the basics around medical procedures - not just in case something goes wrong, but because astronauts are basically medical guinea pigs," she told the [ Australian Space Agency](/story/8338233/). "In space, as your body adapts to weightlessness any medical issues you may have on Earth - such as osteoporosis, or muscle degradation - are put on fast forward and we can support research on that." The Adelaide-born astronaut candidate previously served as Director of Space Technology at the Australian Space Agency, and as part of the space robotics and automation team. In early December, Ms Bennell-Pegg travelled to the United States where she underwent specialised training with NASA in Houston and met with Australian Ambassador to the United States Kevin Rudd in Washington DC. "I'm excited - not just for me - but for what my training and experience can unlock for Australian scientists, engineers and operators, and all the value that can bring," she said. Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date. We care about the protection of your data. Read our [Privacy Policy](/privacy/).

author: Météocity
title: Météo Bordeaux: journée ensoleillée et températures douces, vendredi 11 octobre 2024
text:
Météo Bordeaux: journée ensoleillée et températures douces, vendredi 11 octobre 2024
Des éclaircies aujourd'hui avant une légère averse prévue demain
Découvrez la météo complète de Bordeaux pour le vendredi 11 octobre 2024 : journée ensoleillée avec des températures agréables entre 11°C et 20°C, sans pluie prévue. Profitez de la douceur automnale avec des vents légers du Sud-Est. Prévisions détaillées pour aujourd'hui et les jours suivants.
Le temps à Bordeaux aujourd'hui sera marqué par des éclaircies pour l'ensemble de la journée avec des températures oscillant entre 11°C et 20°C. Inutile de sortir l'ombrelle, aucune précipitation n'est prévue. La qualité de l'air étant bonne et le ciel dégagé, vous pouvez organiser vos activités en extérieur en toute confiance. Profitez de ce bel automne avec un soleil qui se lèvera à 08:13 et se couchera à 19:24. Nos amis du vent Sud-Est seront présents mais discrets, avec des rafales tournant aux alentours de 13km/h. Consultez nos détails de prévision pour Bordeaux aujourd'hui pour plus d'informations.
Pour demain, le temps demeurera ensoleillé et sec avec une légère hausse des températures. Les températures matinales débuteront à un agréable 16°C pour atteindre un confortable 25°C dans la journée. Vous pouvez néanmoins vous attendre à une petite averse de pluie avec une probabilité de 84%, mais la quantité de pluie attendue de 1.1 mm ne devrait pas gâcher la journée. Les vents de Sud-Est souffleront entre 17km/h et 30km/h. Pour plus de détails sur la météo de demain à Bordeaux, consultez notre page de prévisions pour demain.
Nous prévoyons un ciel clair pour après-demain en journée avec une petite hausse de température jusqu'à 26°C. Le temps restera sec avec un vent d'Est-Sud-Est allant jusqu'à 17km/h. Le week-end à venir ne devrait pas s'éloigner de cette tendance alors que nos données anticipent un temps général ensoleillé pour la fin de la semaine.
En regardant plus loin, les données suggèrent un retour à une petite averse de pluie le jour suivant le week-end avec une température maximale en baisse à 19°C. Bien que cette baisse de température puisse ne pas sembler importante, la probabilité de précipitation s'élève à 89%, il est donc préférable de sortir avec votre parapluie ce jour-là. Le vent soufflera en moyenne à 16km/h, venant de l'Est.
En somme, les deux prochains jours s'annoncent plutôt cléments à Bordeaux avec des températures agréables et une probabilité de pluie faible. Toutefois, préparez-vous pour une possible petite averse en début de la semaine prochaine. Dans l'ensemble, qu'il vente, qu'il pleuve ou c'est ensoleillé, Bordeaux reste une ville charmante à explorer!

author: NewsBreak Original
title: FLOODING THREAT: Tropical depression will form, heading for Florida this weekend
text:
By Jennifer Correa, Matt Papaycik ,
6 hours ago Potential Tropical Cyclone Four formed Friday morning over eastern Cuba and is expected to strengthen into a tropical depression, then a tropical storm, and bring heavy rain and flooding to South Florida over the weekend.
The National Hurricane Center said a tropical storm warning is in effect for parts of Southwest Florida from East Cape Sable — at the tip of the Florida Peninsula — north to Bonita Beach.
In addition, a tropical storm watch is in effect for parts of the Florida Keys and coastal Southwest Florida. Palm Beach County and the Treasure Coast are not under any watches or warnings right now.
WPTV The NHC said this wave is expected to develop into a tropical depression on Saturday as it moves across the Straits of Florida, followed by intensification into a tropical storm by Saturday night.
The wave has a 70% chance to develop over the next two days and an 90% chance over the next seven. It's expected to move near or over Cuba throughout the day Friday and then emerge over the Straits of Florida tonight or Saturday.
WPTV TRACKING THE TROPICS: Hurricane Center | Hurricane Guide
"Clouds are bubbling up, indicating thunderstorm activity," WPTV First Alert Weather meteorologist Jennifer Correa said. "But it's still not confined, tight enough that there's a center."
Correa added that environmental conditions are expected to be conducive to additional development, and a tropical depression is likely to form this weekend over the Straits of Florida or eastern Gulf of Mexico near the Florida Peninsula.
Parts of Palm Beach County are under a "slight" risk of excessive rainfall, the second lowest tier, while the rest of our viewing area is under a "marginal" risk, the lowest tier.
"We are under a risk of excessive rainfall. Basically calling for scattered flash flooding," Correa said. "More than likely, the farther south you are, the heavier or the more accumulated rainfall you'll get."
Correa said parts of our area could pick up two to five inches of rainfall over the coming days.
WPTV Correa said the rain and storms will start to ramp up late in the morning on Saturday and continue into Sunday, before eventually clearing out on Monday.
"These scattered showers and thunderstorms are gonna come in almost in feeder bands," Correa said.
WATCH: WPTV First Alert Weather forecast
WPTV First Alert Weather forecast, morning of Aug. 2, 2024 Tropical storm watches or warnings could be issued for portions of Florida later today, Correa said.
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: Canadian Press
title: Blue Jays top Twins 5-1, earn fourth consecutive pre-season win
text:
FORT MYERS, Fla. — Brian Serven hit a two-run homer in the third inning and the Toronto Blue Jays extended their win streak to four games with a 5-1 victory over the Minnesota Twins on Thursday in pre-season play.
Davis Schneider contributed a run with a sacrifice fly, Rafael Lantigua added an RBI double, and Steward Berroa, with a bases-loaded walk, helped power the Toronto (10-9) attack.
Bowden Francis (2-1) threw two strikeouts and allowed four hits and one run in six innings starting on the mound for the Jays. Wes Parsons picked up the save, pitching the final three innings.
Edouard Julien drove in Minnesota's (6-12) lone run with a single in the bottom of the third.
Starting pitcher Bailey Ober (1-1) took the loss for the Twins. He surrendered three runs, four hits, and one walk, while recording three strikeouts in 2 2/3 innings of work.
Toronto next plays the Detroit Tigers on Friday in Dunedin, Fla.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published March 14, 2024.
The Canadian Press

author: Redacción HuffPost
text:
"Gracias y adiós": Alcampo premia a una trabajadora discapacitada e inmediatamente firma su despido
La mujer "sufrió de agotamiento durante años".
Yolande Decamps ha recibido un premio amargo. Después de 40 años trabajando para Alcampo en el norte de Francia, esta sexagenaria ha sido galardonada por los "buenos y leales servicios" que prestó a la compañía. Sin embargo, el día antes de recibirlo, fue despedida.
Según publica el diario francés [La Dépêche](https://www.ladepeche.fr/2024/11/27/merci-au-revoir-apres-40-ans-de-carriere-a-auchan-elle-est-recompensee-dune-medaille-apres-avoir-ete-licenciee-12350380.php), "su salida no se debe al plan nacional de despidos presentado hace unas semanas por la compañía ―ha anunciado 2.389 supresiones de contratos―, sino por su discapacidad". Se trata de una "pérdida de empleo encubierta basada en una incapacidad laboral".
"La ya exempleada sufrió de agotamiento durante muchos años y los puestos que le ofrecían distaban mucho de ser adecuados para su discapacidad", afirma la publicación. El caso está a disposición de los tribunales franceses.
De acuerdo al medio, el galardón ha sido una "desafortunada coincidencia en el calendario". "Para la mujer de 62 años ha sido un poco extraña. Por un lado, fue 'gracias a su inversión', pero por otro 'gracias y adiós".
